intro: Upopion heterophylum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often cultivated for its ornamental value. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
